text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

I would argue that the Blavatnik
community is the one greatest
value to the Fellowship.

They have experts from
the investor side,

from the operator side, from the
legal side, from every corner

of entrepreneurship
that anyone could want.

The mentors have
been incredible.

And people are not only
generous with their time,

they've been
extremely supportive,

and they actually give very
direct, prescriptive advice.

I would describe it maybe as
like a collaborative community.

There's no sense of
a competitive dynamic

between Fellows or between
anyone in the community.

Even our venture partners
and advisors really

just want to see each of
us succeed in our mission.

One very formative
experience was

our lunch with Len Blavatnik,
and he went around,

asked us about our companies,
and basically, whatever
we said, he says, do 10x more.
Increase your scope 10x more.

Increase the ambition 10x
more and increase the impact
10x more.

This is an incredible
opportunity

with a very amazing
cohort of Fellows,

and camaraderie
and the community
that we had was amazing.

Just being able to
talk to other Fellows

about what they're
going through,

their struggles, and how
they're making these problems
more tangible and solvable.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
